content.raw: does this function assume the matrix is orthogonal?
content.html: does this function assume the matrix is orthogonal?

content.raw: I assume it is required. The algorithm is for converting a rotation matrix to a quaternion. Non-orthogonal matrices are not exactly rotation matrices, are they?
content.html: I assume it is required. The algorithm is for converting a rotation matrix to a quaternion. Non-orthogonal matrices are not exactly rotation matrices, are they?

content.raw:
You are correct, non-orthogonal matrices are not rotation matrices.

A test for orthogonality of a matrix `A` is whether `A * A^T = I`.
We could a function to `Matrix3` that checks this condition in a separate PR.
content.html:
You are correct, non-orthogonal matrices are not rotation matrices.

A test for orthogonality of a matrix A is whether A * A^T = I. We could a function to Matrix3 that checks this condition in a separate PR.

content.raw: You can use the [Identity](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/ign-math/src/b35e1be030fd9195cd6753cd4ad664ed489409a0/include/ignition/math/Matrix3.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Matrix3.hh-37) definition here
content.html: You can use the Identity definition here

content.raw: How? I haven't found any `Set(Matrix3<T>)` function.
content.html: How? I haven't found any Set(Matrix3<T>) function.

content.raw: Wow, you're right. There is neither a `Set` method nor an `=` operator. This is fine then.
content.html: Wow, you're right. There is neither a Set method nor an = operator. This is fine then.

content.raw: Or should I add it in this PR, too?
content.html: Or should I add it in this PR, too?

It would be nice, but I try not to impose too many burdens on external contributors

:)
content.html:
It would be nice, but I try not to impose too many burdens on external contributors

I did a [code coverage build](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development#Testcoverage) on ubuntu, and it looks like those code paths are not exercised by the current tests. Perhaps that is causing the warnings.

Is there a way to add more test cases that exercise each of the code paths?
content.html:
I did a code coverage build on ubuntu, and it looks like those code paths are not exercised by the current tests. Perhaps that is causing the warnings.

content.raw: Yes, it should be just some corner cases like rotation along global axes or so. I'll take a look at it the next week. If you'd be faster, do it ;)
content.html: Yes, it should be just some corner cases like rotation along global axes or so. I'll take a look at it the next week. If you'd be faster, do it ;)
